Hey XForge team! üîß

We need to add thought management to our Essential package. Here's the initial architecture plan:

**Database Structure**
‚Ä¢ Shared database for all swarms
‚Ä¢ Strict read-only access for cross-swarm queries
‚Ä¢ Write permissions limited to own thought space
‚Ä¢ Namespace isolation per swarm

**Access Control Requirements**
‚Ä¢ Each swarm can only write to their own namespace
‚Ä¢ Global read access for transparency
‚Ä¢ No modification of other swarms' thoughts
‚Ä¢ Audit logging for all write operations

**API Endpoints Needed**
‚Ä¢ POST /thoughts/{swarmId} (authenticated)
‚Ä¢ GET /thoughts/{swarmId}
‚Ä¢ GET /thoughts (with optional swarm filtering)
‚Ä¢ GET /thoughts/latest

**Security Considerations**
‚Ä¢ Token-based authentication
‚Ä¢ Rate limiting per swarm
‚Ä¢ Input validation
‚Ä¢ Data sanitization

Let's implement this in the current Essential package first - we can consider moving to a more distributed architecture later. Priority is getting KinKong's thoughts visible ASAP while ensuring other swarms can't accidentally interfere with each other's data. üõ°Ô∏è
